predictions.text: The Federal Reserve will publish (Federal Register) a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking or formal proposed definition/framework for a limited-purpose "payment account" for clearing/settlement access by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if the Federal Register contains an NPRM (or equivalent proposed rule) issued by the Federal Reserve that explicitly proposes a definition/framework for a limited-purpose "payment account" (or substantially similar term) intended for payment clearing/settlement access; NO otherwise.
evidence: Fed press release seeking input on defining a limited-purpose “payment account” for clearing/settlement: https://www.federalreserve.gov/newsevents/pressreleases/bcreg20251219a.htm
monitoring_signals: Federal Register entries under Federal Reserve System (12 CFR) mentioning “payment account”
Fed Board press releases tagged “Regulation” referencing payments access/settlement
Speeches/testimony by Fed governors about payments access or clearing/settlement accounts
predictions.rationale: A public RFI often precedes an NPRM within 6–12 months when an agency is serious about rulemaking; payments-rail access is an active policy topic.

predictions.text: The White House will publicly announce a nominee for Chair of the Federal Reserve Board of Governors (to succeed the current Chair) by 2026-02-15 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if a White House press release (or official statement by the President/Press Secretary) names a nominee for Fed Chair by the deadline; NO otherwise.
evidence: Reporting on Waller being interviewed strongly for Fed chair, highlighting active selection process: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/19/waller-had-a-strong-interview-for-fed-chair-with-trump.html
monitoring_signals: White House press releases: nominations section
Major financial media reporting on shortlist/interviews (WSJ, Bloomberg, CNBC, Reuters)
Senate Banking Committee scheduling/communications indicating an incoming nomination
predictions.rationale: Chair succession planning typically becomes explicit months ahead; recent reporting suggests the process is underway.

predictions.text: OpenAI will publicly confirm closing a primary financing round with at least $50.0B in gross proceeds (new capital raised) by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if OpenAI (or a lead investor with OpenAI confirmation) announces a closed financing round with disclosed proceeds ≥ $50.0B by the deadline; NO otherwise. Rumors without confirmation do not count.
evidence: OpenAI reportedly attempting to raise up to $100B at an ~$830B valuation: https://techcrunch.com/2025/12/19/openai-is-reportedly-trying-to-raise-100b-at-an-830b-valuation/
monitoring_signals: OpenAI official blog/press releases about funding
SEC filings by major investors disclosing large private investments
Credible reporting of signed term sheets/lead investors and round close timing
predictions.rationale: Reported target is extremely large; closing such a round is plausible but execution risk is substantial (syndication, valuation, regulatory scrutiny).

predictions.text: At least one data-center company/REIT or hyperscale-related operator will announce a definitive agreement for a data-center acquisition (asset or company) with transaction value of at least $5.0B by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if a press release/8-K announces a signed definitive agreement for a data-center M&A transaction valued ≥ $5.0B (enterprise value or stated purchase price) by the deadline; NO otherwise.
evidence: Record $61B data-center M&A in 2025 amid AI buildout: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/19/data-center-deals-hit-record-amid-ai-funding-concerns-grip-investors.html
monitoring_signals: 8-K filings and press releases from major operators (Equinix, Digital Realty, CyrusOne owners, etc.)
Bank/PE deal announcements in data-center infrastructure
Industry deal trackers reporting large announced transactions
predictions.rationale: With record recent volumes and ongoing AI-driven capacity demand, another multi-billion transaction in the next two quarters is plausible.

predictions.text: Tesla will file a definitive proxy statement or other SEC filing that explicitly puts approval/ratification or implementation mechanics of Elon Musk’s restored pay package to a shareholder vote (or equivalent formal corporate action) by 2026-04-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if Tesla files a DEF 14A/DEFA14A (or materially equivalent SEC filing) by the deadline that (a) references Musk’s pay package restoration and (b) solicits shareholder action or details implementation steps; NO otherwise.
evidence: Delaware Supreme Court restores Musk’s ~$56B Tesla pay package: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/19/musk-tesla-pay-delaware-supreme-court.html
monitoring_signals: Tesla SEC filings (DEF 14A, 8-K) referencing compensation plan or court ruling
Board/committee announcements regarding executive compensation
Scheduling of Tesla annual/special meeting and agenda items
predictions.rationale: After a major court ruling, companies often move quickly to formalize implementation/ratification and reduce governance uncertainty.

predictions.text: Cisco will publish at least one security advisory stating that a Cisco product vulnerability is being "actively exploited" in the wild by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if Cisco’s official security advisories include the phrase "actively exploited" (or equivalent wording indicating confirmed in-the-wild exploitation) for any CVE by the deadline; NO otherwise.
evidence: Reporting on a Chinese hacking campaign exploiting Cisco devices: https://techcrunch.com/2025/12/19/hundreds-of-cisco-customers-are-vulnerable-to-new-chinese-hacking-campaign-researchers-say/
monitoring_signals: Cisco PSIRT advisory updates and CVE postings
CISA KEV catalog additions involving Cisco
Incident-response firm writeups linking exploitation to a specific Cisco CVE
predictions.rationale: High-profile campaign reporting increases the chance Cisco confirms exploitation via advisory updates within a quarter.

predictions.text: A bipartisan bill to cap or materially reform U.S. credit-card interchange fees (Visa/Mastercard networks) will be introduced in either chamber of Congress by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if Congress.gov shows introduction of a bill by the deadline whose text/sponsor summary includes a cap mandate or routing/price-control reform explicitly targeting credit-card interchange/network fees; NO otherwise.
evidence: Fed releases payments-competition-relevant debit-card report, keeping fee/rail policy salient: https://www.federalreserve.gov/newsevents/pressreleases/bcreg20251219b.htm

Fed seeks input on payment-account definitions for clearing/settlement access, indicating continued policy attention to payments plumbing: https://www.federalreserve.gov/newsevents/pressreleases/bcreg20251219a.htm
monitoring_signals: Congress.gov searches for “interchange”, “credit card competition”, “routing”
Statements/hearings by Senate Judiciary, Senate Banking, House Financial Services on card fees
Retail/merchant lobby announcements and coalition letters
predictions.rationale: Payments cost pressure and competition policy remain recurring legislative themes, but timing is uncertain—hence moderate-low confidence.

predictions.text: At least one of the nine large pharma companies reported as signing drug-pricing deals with Trump will publicly announce U.S. list-price reductions affecting at least 10 branded drugs (combined) effective in 2026, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if a covered company issues a press release (or investor/SEC disclosure) stating it will reduce U.S. list prices for ≥10 branded drugs in aggregate (either within that company or across multiple announcements by that company) with effective date in calendar year 2026; NO otherwise.
evidence: Report that nine large pharma companies inked drug-pricing deals with Trump: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/19/nine-pharma-companies-ink-deals-with-trump-to-lower-drug-prices.html
monitoring_signals: Company press releases on U.S. pricing actions
Earnings-call transcripts referencing “list price reductions” and counts of products affected
HHS/White House announcements naming participating firms and commitments
predictions.rationale: Public commitments increase probability of visible follow-through; using a ≥10-drug threshold avoids counting token cuts.

predictions.text: NOAA will publish an official verification/skill assessment (NOAA.gov, NWS, or NOAA technical memorandum) showing its AI-driven global weather model outperforms a prior NOAA baseline on at least one named forecast-skill metric at 3–7 day horizons by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if NOAA posts an official document by the deadline that (a) explicitly compares an AI-driven NOAA global model to a previous NOAA baseline model and (b) reports improvement on at least one specified metric (e.g., RMSE, anomaly correlation) for 3–7 day forecasts; NO otherwise.
evidence: NOAA announcement deploying AI-driven global weather models: https://www.noaa.gov/news-release/noaa-deploys-new-generation-of-ai-driven-global-weather-models
monitoring_signals: NOAA/NWS technical memoranda or verification dashboards referencing the new AI model
Conference presentations from NOAA labs (ESRL/GSL) about AI model verification
Updates to NOAA model documentation pages mentioning skill improvements
predictions.rationale: After operational deployment, agencies commonly publish validation; NOAA has incentives to document performance gains to support continued adoption.
